item.title: Corona Geek #71 – PreApps CEO, Sean Casto Talks About App Marketing Before Launch
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: During today's Hangout PreApps CEO, Sean Casto talked about the importance of marketing apps early. Sean explained how PreApps helps developers and consumers come together in mutually rewarding ways. PreApps provides developers with tools and resources to help them get exposure, collect feedback, acquire beta testers, and establish an audience before their apps reach the app store, while users earn rewards for participating.
item.content:encoded:
During today’s Hangout PreApps CEO, Sean Casto talked about the importance of marketing apps early. Sean explained how PreApps helps developers and consumers come together in mutually rewarding ways. PreApps provides developers with tools and resources to help them get exposure, collect feedback, acquire beta testers, and establish an audience before their apps reach the app store, while users earn rewards for participating.

Sign up for a PreApps developer account and use the promo code “CoronaLabs” at checkout to try their PreApps Featured Feedback app posting free for 30 days.

Join us this Saturday, January 11th 2014, for the first Dallas Corona SDK Meeting of the year at Reel FX’s Dallas studio. Dr. Brian Burton will be sharing information on how to build apps using Corona SDK. Come eat pizza, meet app developers, and see where the movie animation magic happens.

Thank you for listening to and following Corona Geek:

  • Download the Corona Geek podcast on iTunes
  • Listen to Corona Geek on Stitcher
  • Subscribe to Corona Geek on YouTube

item.title: Corona Geek #69 – Creating Seasonal Apps, Augmented Rendering, and App Stocking Stuffers
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: During this holiday edition of Corona Geek, Corona Ambassador Jen Looper demoed her Christmas Math Challenge app. We talked about what it takes to launch an app in time for the holiday rush, when app reskinning is a good practice, and how to use the camera filter in Graphics 2.0 to do augmented rendering.
item.content:encoded:
During this holiday edition of Corona Geek, Corona Ambassador Jen Looper demoed her Christmas Math Challenge app. We talked about what it takes to launch an app in time for the holiday rush, when app reskinning is a good practice, and how to use the camera filter in Graphics 2.0 to do augmented rendering.

Other things we mentioned on the show:

  • Corona Indie Devs Facebook Group
  • Dallas Corona SDK Meeting, January 11th 2014
  • Elf Yourself app, by OfficeMax
  • BossJock podcasting app for iOS
  • Santa Rockstar Versus Aliens for Android
  • WindSquire by Mindgrub Games
  • Zombie Puzzle Invasion

Thank you to everyone who watched the live Corona Geek Hangout on YouTube.

Congratulations to Carl Derkins for winning this week’s Corona Labs’ t-shirt. For your chance to win, follow Corona Geek on Twitter, Facebook, Google+, or YouTube and complete the Corona Geek giveaway form.

Remember To Subscribe

  • Download the Corona Geek podcast on iTunes
  • Listen to Corona Geek on Stitcher
  • Subscribe to Corona Geek on YouTube

item.title: Building A Brand Around Mobile Apps
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: During this week's Corona Geek Hangout, David L. Hoyt, the world's most syndicated daily game creator and now puzzle app maker, shared his thoughts on why it's important to build a brand around a mobile app and how that plays into the app's long term marketing strategy.
item.content:encoded:
During this week’s Corona Geek Hangout, David L. Hoyt, the world’s most syndicated daily game creator and now puzzle app maker, shared his thoughts on why it’s important to build a brand around a mobile app and how that plays into the app’s long term marketing strategy.

If you enjoy our weekly Corona Geek Hangouts, be sure to “thumbs up” and rate the shows!

Thanks for subscribing!

    • Download the Corona Geek podcast on iTunes
    • Listen to Corona Geek on Stitcher
    • Subscribe to Corona Geek on YouTube

item.title: App Marketing Tips from Eric Kinkead, Creator of Questlord
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: In May, Eric Kinkead gave an excellent talk on app marketing to the Dallas Corona SDK Meetup Group. Eric has had great success with his game Questlord, which is a turn-based Role Playing Game (RPG) in the classic style of the legendary Computer Role Playing Games that defined the genre. Eric shared both his successes and mistakes with marketing Questlord and we got it all on video.
item.content:encoded:
In May, Eric Kinkead gave an excellent talk on app marketing to the Dallas Corona SDK Meetup Group. Eric has had great success with his game Questlord, which is a turn-based Role Playing Game (RPG) in the classic style of the legendary Computer Role Playing Games that defined the genre. Eric shared both his successes and mistakes with marketing Questlord and we got it all on video. Thank you Eric for sharing an honest recount of your app marketing experience.

Be sure to check out the Questlord website for more details on how Eric is promoting his game.

Remember To Subscribe

  • Download the Corona Geek podcast on iTunes
  • Listen to Corona Geek on Stitcher
  • Subscribe to Corona Geek on YouTube

item.title: App Monetization Using The Tap for Tap Plugin
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: This week we hung out with Eric Dyck and Phil Laird from Tap for Tap to talk about their new Corona SDK plugin. Tap for Tap offers app promotion and monetization for app developers looking to market their apps and increase their sales. Tap for Tap is a Featured Partner on the Corona SDK Plugin Directory.
item.content:encoded:
This week we hung out with Eric Dyck and Phil Laird from Tap for Tap to talk about their new Corona SDK plugin. Tap for Tap offers app promotion and monetization for app developers looking to market their apps and increase their sales. Tap for Tap is a Featured Partner on the Corona SDK Plugin Directory.

 

Thank you for watching, we’ll see you on next week’s Corona Geek hangout!

Remember To Subscribe

  • Download the Corona Geek podcast on iTunes
  • Listen to Corona Geek on Stitcher
  • Subscribe to Corona Geek on YouTube

item.title: Corona Geek #42 – Space Monsters Love Bullets
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: This week we hung out with Dean Murphy, Ed Maurina, Mark Eberhardt, Matthew Chapman, Michael Wilson, Mohamed Bennouf, Rob Englebright, Rob Haney, and Theo Rushin, Jr. to discuss the Space Monsters Love Bullets Kickstarter campaign, Tiled, and Corona Tiled.
item.content:encoded:
This week we hung out with Dean Murphy, Ed Maurina, Mark Eberhardt, Matthew Chapman, Michael Wilson, Mohamed Bennouf, Rob Englebright, Rob Haney, and Theo Rushin, Jr. to discuss the Space Monsters Love Bullets Kickstarter campaign, Tiled, and Corona Tiled.

Corona Labs T-Shirt Winner

Congratulations to Derek Justus for winning this week’s Corona Labs’ t-shirt. For your chance to win, follow Corona Geek on Twitter and Facebook, and complete the Corona Geek giveaway form.

 

Thank you for watching, we’ll see you on next week’s Corona Geek hangout!
